Articles.Content:
My challenge for you:

Build an SSTO.

The catch:

No jet engines or wings, and it has to land at the KSC like a plane.

There is no points system for this challenge, I just need to see screenshots:

On the launchpad

100 meters

Gravity turn

In orbit

Landed on the runway

Happy Flying!

how do you plan to land on the runway with no wings (aerodynamic surfaces?)....

I think you should allow wings... just specify a vertical launch.... and have a scoring method

Hmmm, personally I think it'd be more interesting if the rule were "wings are allowed, parachutes are not"

It's harder to glide a plane to a safe landing than to pull the chutes and drift slowly down. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
What about control surfaces? Are winglets/canards/etc allowed?
Control surfaces are allowed, you can use RCS thrusters in landing.

does this count?

it can bring 40t payload to orbit and land

the plane looking thing at the top is a shuttle that carries 7 kerbals & ~1500deltaV (also reusable)

if landed perfectly this craft can cost 0 funds even with the shuttle as a payload
